description: Provides the location and metadata of the media files corresponding to time range segments of a Flow.
title: Flow Segment

object_id.description: The object store identifier for the media object.

ts_offset.description: The timestamp offset between the timestamps stored in the media file and the corresponding timestamp in the segment, ie. ts_offset = segment ts - media object ts. Assumed to be 0:0 if not set.

range.description: The timerange from the first media unit in the segment to the last (exclusive end if exclusive_last_ts is true).

first_ts.description: The timestamp of the first media unit in the segment (which may not be the first unit in the object).

last_duration.description: The duration of the last media unit in the segment (which may differ from that of the object). Defaults to 1/rate if a fixed media rate is set.

last_ts.description: The timestamp of the start of the last media unit in the segment, or end of the last media unit in the segment if exclusive_last_ts is true.

exclusive_last_ts.description: A true value indicates that the last_ts timestamp is the exclusive end of the last media unit in the segment.

sample_offset.description: The start of the segment represented as a count of audio samples, video frames or data items from the start of the object.

sample_count.description: The count of media units in the segment (which may be fewer than in the object). The count could be less than expected given the segment duration and rate if there are gaps. If not set, every sample in the object is used

get_url.description: A URL to which a GET request can be made to directly retrieve the contents of the segment. This is optional, and not all media store backends may provide it.

key_frame_count.description: The number of key frames in the segment
